review.title: Convenient to SF Jazz
review.reviewText: pleasantly surprised at the room.  spacious w/ large HD TV.  but...no HD.   I found the bed to be comfortable but my wife thought it to be a bit too firm.  updated decor w/ small couch and desk/chair.  The free b-fast left much to be desired.
review.positiveRemarks: free parking.  but it is first come, first get...limited amount of spaces
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to civic center area.  Hayes street to the south is a nice stroll w/ great selection of restaurants, bars and coffee joints.

review.reviewText: Great for the price  but if you're walking lots of homeless sleeping on the sidewalks
I found it correct,  but not warm neither atractive. I didn't feel too comgortable.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This is a decent hotel in a great location. Nothing fancy but free parking and walking distance to opera, symphony and great shops and restaurants make it a real bargain
Great location! Hotel really clean with free parking

review.title: I felf so good that i expected.
review.reviewText:
예상하고 간것보다 방이 너무 넓고 편해서 너무 좋았습니다.
깨끗하고 침대 넓고 같이 간 친구들 모두 만족했어요
review.positiveRemarks: 넉넉항 방 크기
review.negativeRemarks: 옆방이 좀 시끄러우면 들려요.
review.locationRemarks:
위치 매우 좋습니다.
근처에 맛있는 식당이 많이있고 접근성이 좋아요

review.title: Nice hotel, great neighborhood
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at the Civic Center's Days Inn.  It is NOT a fancy hotel, but offers the basics in a clean comfortable setting.  They offer breakfast, a plus, and it is located in the Hayes Valley, a terrific neighborhood that has everything you need within walking distance.  It is near the opera house, symphony hall, fine and less expensive  restaurants, nice shops, a Walgreen's drug store and a parklet.  Neighborhood feels very safe for walking.  I am very happy to stay there when I go to the opera.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, location, neighborhood, breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Towel rack far from tub/shower, shelf too low to sink, odd mirror light in mirror blocks part view of face, not enough room to put toiletries.
review.locationRemarks: The Hayes Valley neighborhood is great!.  Fine and less expensive restaurants, nice shops, drug store, safe easy walking, opera house, symphony hall.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: For one night it was ok. First experence with staff was not good she was quite rude.

We arrived at the hotel at 1:40pm and were not allowed to check-in. Though definitely all rooms were ready, we were told that we should come at 2pm for check-in.... We spent 20 minutes just outside of their lobby since we did not want to loose the last available parking space. We travel a lot; and it was the first time when a hotel stuff didn't even look at  our reservation to see if our room was ready...

 The breakfast was just ok, though get your coffee somewhere else :-)
review.positiveRemarks: The location was very good for our itinerary.

review.title: Neat but noisy
review.reviewText:
The Days Inn San Francisco Downtown is not a bad hotel, more of a classic motel-style place, and while it's pretty basic in its arrangement, it's neat, tidy and well-presented.

It can also be very noisy, though, especially late at night, with noise bleeding in from other rooms, from the central car park and from locals who sometimes spill over from the Tenderloin. The neighbourhood itself is very pleasant, but it's only a short walk to a rougher and less safe area of town, so consider where you need to be and what neighbourhoods you need to pass through to and from the hotel. That said, I think the hotel itself is pretty safe. On a different week, you might have a perfectly restful stay, but I was kept up some nights.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, good bathrooms, good access to the rest of town.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise levels, room insulation.
review.locationRemarks: Hayes is a good neighbourhood with some excellent restaurants and cafés, but the nearby Tenderloin is quite rough.

review.title: Close to symphony, opera
review.reviewText:
Very convenient location close to civic center, SF opera, symphony. The area is reasonably safe. Price OK.
Rooms are OK. Staff was friendly. the only little disturbing thing is that the lights outside are on all night and shining bright making it hard to get the room dark.
Free parking is available but very limited.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Free parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Bright lights at night.
review.locationRemarks: symphony, opera, many restaurants.

review.title: Good for what it is...
review.reviewText:
I stayed at this hotel in early January 2016 for a week.  First off, the location is fantastic: very walkable to performing arts venues, city hall, museums and there public transit past the door.  There are also a lot of great restaurants nearby.

The room is relatively clean, although I did find stray hairs on the bathroom floor that were not mine, both when I checked in and during my stay, some of which I suspect were from the cleaning staff.  The bathroom had all of the ambiance of a fast food restaurant bathroom.  The TV had some issues (the top two inches of the screen were damaged), but the cable selection was great.  The room came with a fridge and microwave, but the fridge constantly made noise which I was able to tune out, and kept freezing my beverages, but I was eventually able to fix it.

The staff were relatively friendly, and the cleaning staff did not speak much English, although they were nice enough.

The major drawback is that the walls are paper-thin.  There was a couple above me making loud noises until after 2:00 AM on my last night that kept me up, and I could hear people talking at even a conversational level in the other rooms.

If you're on a budget, and want walkability, and don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room, I would recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: The location!
review.negativeRemarks: I'm not sure anything can be done about the noise transfer, given the age of the building, but the bathrooms could stand to be a little nicer.
review.locationRemarks: Nice and central, close to the performing arts district and public transit.

review.title: Clean, quiet, great location for symphony, opera,
review.reviewText: Great walkable location for arts venues. Hip Hayes Valley has lots of restaurants and trendy shops.Easy free parking, very quiet for motel in the city. Great value for price. Staff very helpful, would definitely stay again.

review.title: Good value for the location
review.reviewText: We stay here when we attend the symphony or opera. It's not luxurious but it is clean and has a great location. Parking is included in the room charge. We can walk to the performances

review.title: Ok hotel in the middle of San Fran
review.reviewText: OK hotel in the middle of San Francisco with a few free limited parking spaces.

review.title: good value , super location
review.reviewText: much nicer than the Day's Inn you make think of. super location near opera house symphony. very walkable. loads of excellent restaurants nearby. great shopping neighborhood. very clean. parking is available which is a GIFT for this location.
review.positiveRemarks: location

review.title: Close to Civic Center but..
review.reviewText: It is a 60's motel with not much updating. Noisy unless you are on the third or fourth floor. Clean rooms but the AC/heater is old and very noisy. Didn't expect to watch TV but if you want to it will be on an old tube with funky controls and a poor quality picture that goes all fuzzy as various electric circuits cycle on and off. Bottom line: clean and it will do in a pinch, pricing is surprisingly high given the state of the place.
Good Continental breakfast. Rooms need updating, but are clean and comfortable.

review.title: Sketchy area, limited parking, run-down
review.reviewText: We reserved rooms for 2 nights but we wanted to cancel our second night and stay elsewhere. We couldn't cancel because we would still have to pay for our rooms. We stayed both nights and can't wait to get out of here.
Rude staff member, room smelled bad. Bed & bathroom were fine.

review.title: Overall it was alright.
review.reviewText: There were some areas of the room that seemed like they had never been dusted, so it made me question the cleanliness. The sink had duct tape around the pipe that was coming off. There were no bugs, so that's a huge plus, and it was just a mile away from where I needed to be...so if I had to, I'd probably stay again.

review.title: Hotel with limited parking in SF
review.reviewText: Be aware that the advertised free parking is not guaranteed, since the parking space is limited to about 10 cars.

review.title: Cost effective clean hotel in good area
review.reviewText: Days Inn delivered as expected. The room was of good size and clean. It was in a great location for every thing in San Fran and was very safe to walk around. Great value for the money spent as hotels in SF can be expensive. I would stay at the Days Inn again.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, safe, clean
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff was little aloof.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurant/bar, "The Grove", BierGarten, Smitten Ice cream. Easy walk to the F line.

review.title: It was close to where we needed to go.
review.reviewText: It was a great place for our family trip. We were able to walk and enjoy the city's shopping and entertainment.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and comfortable
review.locationRemarks: If you like to walk and get out and see the city, this is a great place to stay. We'd love to come back.

review.reviewText: This hotel has a perfect location, you can walk to symphony hall, many restaurants, movies, bookstores.  The outside of the hotel is a bit shabby. The staff was nice, the room was fine for one night, parking was INCLUDED in the price.  We'll stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and price
review.negativeRemarks: curb appeal
review.locationRemarks: Symphony Hall, the ballet, restaurants, shopping.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: We had a room were the carpet had 3 Iron burn marks on the Floor but the room was clean.  And very close to the venue so we were able to walk.  I will stay here again however maybe the can get new carpet in room 104.
review.positiveRemarks: It was walking distance to the venue.
review.negativeRemarks: New Carpet in the rooms.

review.title: Close to the opera
review.reviewText: Check in was not wonderful as desk staff did not make me feel welcome and no room was available for check-in at 11:45.  I went back at 1:00 and got into my room at 1:15.  However, while not very friendly, he did his job.  Motel is older style, somewhat dated, but clean and comfortable with a surprisingly spacious room.  They provide a breakfast (cereal, oatmeal, juice, yogurt, bread, hard boiled eggs, coffee) in a small room with only 4 tables.  They also have limited free parking.  Housekeeping staff was especially friendly and helpful.  The neighborhood is trendy especially in the Hayes Valley (Gough and Hayes Streets) with shops and restaurants in all price ranges.  I felt safe walking around both day and night.  For me, the best part was the short walk to the opera house.  Walking back to the motel at night felt good with Grove St. being well lit and other people around making me feel safe.  For going to the opera or symphony, this modestly priced motel to me is ideal if you are not into fancy, but are OK with a clean, comfortable place to stay in a nice neighborhood.  I'll definitely return.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable fairly spacious room, free breakfast, short walk to the opera house, nice neighborhood, moderate price.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk could be friendlier making you feel welcome.  Room décor could stand some updating.
review.locationRemarks: Trendy area with shops and restaurants in all price levels.  Hayes Valley (Gough and Hayes) was especially nice.  Opera house, symphony hall nearby.

review.title: Adequate facilities in Civic Center area.
review.reviewText:
The hotel room was clean and well maintained. It was a little pricey, based on what you get, but couldn't find any better for the price in S.F.  Managed to get a parking place in hotel lot, but there are more guest rooms than parking places.
The hotel staff attention varied...   one person was just doing his job, while another was very thorough in getting you the information when asked. Cleaning and maintenance crew stayed on top of things.
Breakfast offering was as good as can be expected.
review.positiveRemarks: Transportation was close by.
review.locationRemarks:
If you are looking for something by the Civic Center, I would recommend.
If I visit S.F. again, I will probably look near Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was pricey for a small room - but quiet, well located to public transport/touristy things, and included limited parking tho we always found space. Continental b'fast only cereal toast, juice, coffee. No vending machines. Front office staff helpful.

review.title: Perfect location to get to the center of the city
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay at downtown inn only slight problem You have to leave the tap water to run for a while before it gets warmed up other than that it's a very good hotel and would definately stay there again room was cleaned  daily very good standard  staff very nice and helpful very good team. hotel perfect location to get to market Street and civic center metro station before I left I took one of their cards a clear indication that I would stay there if I ever retired to san francisco

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice clean place to stay in diwntown San Fransisco eith free parking! Nice location close to shops and restaurants and public transportation, the lady at the front desk could be a little friendlier and she doesnt answer the phone when I called a couple of times about minor issues so had to go to the office but other than that no big deal, already have a room booked for a  couple of upcoming trips mainly because of free parking and really like the location! Room was comfortable too with fridge and microwave.

review.title: Close to Orpheum Theater
review.reviewText: Free parking, great front desk staff, and little burger/wing joint right on the property!
Staff were nice. Room staff but comfortable. Little restaurant just near by were excellent!  Market street near by for any convenience. Used Iber for transportation, was greet stay overall!
review.locationRemarks: Stack restaurant was fantastic! Just around the corner

review.reviewText: Excellent downtown San Francisco motel, great value for such a prime location.  Quiet, clean, and comfortable.  Excellent for travelers who want to spend the night in a great city, but want to keep things affordable.

review.title: Negative comments
review.reviewText: Parking though free is limited and not guaranteed.  The room smelled.  Layout of rooms was not visitor friendly.  The hotel is older and needs a makeover!  The front desk lady was rude.

review.title: Very Nice Location & Price
review.reviewText: If you are going to San Francisco for Pride -- or any event located in the Civic Center area -- this is a wonderful location. There is free/limited parking. You can walk to all the great shops/restaurants in Hayes Valley. Free breakfast -- although there are so many nice brunch/breakfast places in walking distance that it isn't needed. Room is clean, comfortable and felt safe. Good TV offerings/reception. Price at this time was very reasonable.
review.positiveRemarks: There is a microwave and refrigerator in the room. Free wi-fi was fast. Location allows you to walk to wonderful restaurants. Public transit is good.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price, nothing needs to be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Symphony, Opera, Ballet, fine (and budget) dining -- in fact a huge variety of places to eat/drink within walking distance.

review.title: Shabby old hotel in excellent location
review.reviewText: We've been regulars for years at this Days Inn, mainly because it is two blocks from the opera house and symphony hall. Frankly, it doesn't have much competition in this location, so we keep coming back. The staff are very friendly, and we've gotten to know them well. We usually take one of the suites, which are a bargain given their size.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much could be done to fix up this tired old building.
review.locationRemarks: The Civic Center, War Memorial Opera House, Symphony Hall, Asian Museum of Art, Conservatory, and many excellent restaurants are within a few blocks.

review.reviewText: clean and quiet, central location with good access to public transport

review.title: They moved us
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel then after payment they had no rooms left so moved us to their sister hotel Adante which is in a seedy part of town in a noisy area cheaper would not recommend at all
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were good bed comfortable great bathroom

review.title: Good hotel in a quiet neibourhood.
review.reviewText: Pleasant stay on a short visit. The room had a telephone, an old fashion tube tv, a microwave, and a fridge, iron, and so on.The bathroom and the room were very clean and simple.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location and wifi connection, quiet neibourhood, close to public transportation, and the variety of choise in breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Hd lcd tv.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance from Civic Center, Alamo Square, and close to public transportation. Buses come frequently on Van Ness, or McAllister.

review.title: Rock n Roll Half Marathon
review.reviewText: The desk clerk was amazing at check-in, and was very helpful in finding places to eat and connecting us with a cab.
review.positiveRemarks: Very good location for the finish line of the half marathon, and there are some amazing restaurants around there.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Many wonderful restaurants and close to a Walgreens in case you forgot something on your trip.

review.reviewText: We stayed for 2 nights. Our room was cleaned the second day we were there, but the hotel staff did not give us a second set of towels

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Pleasant stay in San Francisco .  We will stay there again .
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants

review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great however the hotel itself is run down.

review.title: Good location. Very basic accomodation.
review.reviewText: Hotel could do some upgrading of rooms. Nevertheless we had a good stay given the good location of the hotel--close to shops, restaurants, and bus stops.

review.title: Great Location and value
review.reviewText: This hotel is very convenient to he performing arts and government buildings.  It is clean and comfortable and has free parking in front of the rooms.  One block to the symphony, opera, ballet and lots of restaurants and shops within a short walk.  Will definitely stay here again when attending a concert or opera.
review.positiveRemarks: location

review.title: Close to civic center
review.reviewText: Great hotel... as long as you're not staying in room 102... or else all you will hear is a door slamming during seven am to ten am because of the breakfast.. it's literally impossible to sleep..

review.title: Ok location, mediocre accommodations
review.reviewText: One thing that made us book was the moderate room price plus free parking. Note that parking is VERY limited. We parked 4 blocks away in the street and woke up very early the next day looking out our window waiting for someone to vacate a spot. We finally secured a spot at 730am but it was pretty stressful. The room is very basic and the breakfast is even more basic. This is a no frills place in a good location. Near public transport and walking distance to Market Street.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Near bus stops. We took a bus to Fisherman's wharf, rented bikes and biked from SF across Golden Gate to Sausalito and took ferry back.
review.negativeRemarks: Facility needs some upgrade. Breakfast could improve. Coffee is plain awful.
review.locationRemarks: Market Street is walking distance. Public transport is nearby so we just parked our car in the hotel.

review.reviewText: The Room was too small, and the parking is small too

review.title: Clean Hotel, breakfast is good, suitable location
review.reviewText:
Usulally hotel location is very closed to Metro and Public Transportation...
Rooms are clean, breakfast is very good....
review.positiveRemarks: cleaning and breakfast
review.locationRemarks: The hotel location is very nice, they are many restorant and small boutique shops at near the hotel...

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Great value in Downtown SF.  Free parking is great.  Room is basic but comfortable.  Easy to access the hotel.  Free breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking
review.negativeRemarks: TVs need to be upgraded, ancient and not working well

review.title: Clean, updated rooms, great location.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed easy, quick check-in.  Upon entering the room we found a rather small totally updated comfortable accommodation including a very nicely appointed bathroom.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, off street parking, helpful employees, clean, modern room, morning breakfast.    Also quite location.
review.negativeRemarks: Fruit should be offered with breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Location is quite, close to public transportation and is walking distance to Civic Center and theaters.

review.reviewText: staff was rude, rooms were not great.  It was overpriced for what it was. Will never stay there again
review.positiveRemarks: nothing

review.title: Nice, reasonably priced hotel in San Francisco, CA
review.reviewText: We drove in from the Oakland Airport in the evening.  We didn't know the area and got lost, but the night clerk (a young, indian gent) stayed with us on the phone and brought us in easily.  Our room immediately smelled like smoke and the wonderful night clerk dropped everything and changed our room immediately.  We loved him!  Too bad the next two female day clerks weren't nice at all.  The first gal got mad at us because we had to have her open the breakfast room door when we couldn't get it open for us.  The next gal got mad at us when we went down and let her know that we were running a few minutes behind at check out time.  We wish we had the night clerk the whole time.  The tv kept blacking out every once in a while and popping back on in a couple mins.  I was going to report it, but I didn't want to deal with the day clerk on the last day anymore than we had to.
review.positiveRemarks: The night clerk on 11-23 and 11-24-14.  He made us feel welcome and special.   The pillows are great!  Wish I could have a couple.  Comfy beds!
review.negativeRemarks: Teach the two day clerks patience and better customer service attitudes.  11-24 and 11-25-14
review.locationRemarks: There were nice restaurants and a grocery store nearby.  The walk to city hall and our Hop on Hop Off bus stop wasn't too far for us old ladies!

review.reviewText: There was many noise during sleeping time at hotel.

review.title: Comfortable .
review.reviewText: Comfortable. No problems . Easy check in .  nice people . good room .
Here for work...ok place to stay. Good burger place in th hotel.

review.title: Great value in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We have stayed here several times, and always had a good experience.  It's reasonably priced, close to transportation, restaurants and shopping.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was right in Hayes Valley.  Bus stops right outside the door and also within two blocks.  Great restaurants close by.  Comfortable room.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is a bit old, and could use some updating of the elevator.  It was noisy at night during our most recent stay.
review.locationRemarks: Near the Civic Center, St. Mary's Cathedral and Japantown.  Buses to Golden Gate Park and the Waterfront within 2 blocks.

review.title: Exactly what we were looking for
review.reviewText: Of course it's not a luxury hotel but we were looking for a nice place to be based and to sleep at a good price in the Civic Center/Hayes Valley area.  We got that, and add free WiFi & a breakfast, easy walking to restaurants, pubs, culture, public transit, etc.; the Days Inn Civic Center was just what we were looking/hoping for.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, basic room, free WiFi, breakfast (basic, but just fine), good location, good price.
review.locationRemarks: Surrounded by good restaurants, pubs, MUNI to all parts of the city, walking distance to BART (to/from airport), many cultural institutions

review.title: OK motel with good location
review.reviewText:
OK motel with good location, free parking(but very limited spaces). bus 21 at door step. Room clean and breakfast OK. One of the staff was really friendly, helping us print the Alcatraz ticket, but the other staff was quite rude to my husband, when we finished breakfast, he went to the reception looking for restroom, in stead of saying 'can i help you' to my husband, she responded 'excuse me' with annoyed tone, which we were not impressed.
Overall, its quite good value for money for San Francisco standard and this motel provides free parking, however you have to get there early to secure the limited places.

review.title: OK motel in great location
review.reviewText: If you want a serviceable hotel really close to the Opera,  this is perfect.

review.title: Great for what it is
review.reviewText: I stayed in the hotel because of it's proximity to an event I was attending and and it's reasonable (for San Francisco) rates.  It's really more of a motel than a hotel, but that is exactly what I expected.  No frills, but clean.
review.positiveRemarks:
1. The gentleman that checked me in was very helpful and efficient.
2. Free parking, which is amazing in San Francisco.
3. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks:
1.The towels smelled like bleach, but I guess that's better than being unsanitary.
2. Ancient TV with limited options.
review.locationRemarks:
1. SFJazz center
2. New Conservatory Theatre Center
3. Nourse Theater
3. Many bars and restaurants.

review.title: Great location, large room
review.reviewText: Wonderful time at this hotel great location with great restaurants and close to Fishermans wharf also 10 minutes away
review.positiveRemarks: Location and large clean room
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Resturants

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: We booked this place not knowing what to expect but very pleasant surprise ! Place is clean it was quiet and location was good,, it's not 5* and it's not 5* prices so I think a little unfair of some comments on here,, walk 500 mtrs and your in market st catch the old 'F' tram to fishermans wharf for $2:25c or stop of along the way,,, we would stay here again definatley ,, UK

review.title: Close to everything in San Francisco by car
review.reviewText: It looks dated on the outside, but the inside was clean and comfortable.  There was also a small restaurant attached to the hotel which was pretty good too.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to find off the freeway, free parking (if you get there early enough), attached restaurant, Rooms had fridge and microwave plus free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: More parking spaces.  Street parking is impossible.
review.locationRemarks: By car, you're close to Golden Gate Park, The Presidio, Fishermans Wharf and downtown. Walking close to Civic Center and downtown.

review.title: Clean and tidy motel, close to CBD by car.
review.reviewText:
Although a little pricey for a motel, it was clean and tidy, the bed was great and the selection of channels was good also. Free wifi was fast enough, and the free parking was available. 
Overall staff were friendly, and the rooms are clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort of room, good bed and great shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the TVs
review.locationRemarks: If you're up for a long walk you can walk all the way to through anywhere in downtown San Fran, or fishermans wharf. Better to drive though.

review.title: Out of order lift
review.reviewText:
The hotel has a good location in the city center of SF but with crampy parking lot. 
The only single lift for the whole building (and to my 4th floor room) was out of order. The television is probably two-decade old and poorly tuned. The toilet has a noisy ventilator fan (probably falling down soon).  Limited breakfast just to survive.
review.positiveRemarks: two stars
review.negativeRemarks:
the hotel's buildings, lift and amenities
the will to improve
review.locationRemarks: good location in the city center with hotel's free parking lot

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText:
Nice motel in perfect location!
Clean and calm street situated in "cool" neighborhood.
Lots of trendy restaurants, bars and cafés nearby.
Coin-operated self-service laudromat only two blocks away.
Public transportation at walking distance.

Requested room on upper floor but got ground floor instead. Peaceful and quiet, though.
AC only, windows won't open. Air was heavy after 3-4 days.
Breakfast was basic, could have more variety.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean and calm, free parking, breakfast included.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast & ventilation.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of cool shops & restaurants nearby. No "attractions" but nice to begin or end the day in this neighborhood. Laundromat nearby.

review.title: Dusty, Scary!
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel for a brief business trip. The room felt super dusty, and the sheets from the bed felt like it had not be washed in a long time. It was very scary staying here, there was someone trying to force the door open during the night. I didn't feel safe, the hotel was not clean and there was not enough space for parking for all the guests in the hotel. Please stay somewhere else and don't waste you money here.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need to be cleaner. The overall safety of the rooms. There should not be people walking around the hotel trying to open other guests rooms.

review.title: Emergency Accommodation - Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: We had just missed a flight and needed a place to stay on short notice. The Hotel looked run down from outside, but our room was clean, comfortable and spacious.
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasantly surprised about the quality of the room
review.negativeRemarks: Exterior is tired.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to the Hotel from the train station. The neighborhood feels quite sketchy at night. (Even around civic buildings)

review.title: Good hotel for a city trip.
review.reviewText: Our stay was fine, the hotel is okay and central. The breakfast is fine and we enjoyed our time in the city. The only disappointing part was, that we forgot something at the hotel and the staff was really not very cooperative in helping us to get it back to Monterey area. In the end we decided to spend another Saturday in San Francisco and pick it up.
review.positiveRemarks: It's central, uncomplicated, it has free parking and a decent breakfast.

review.title: Within Walking Distance to Civic Center
review.reviewText: We were able to walk to dinner and go for a run...great location

review.title: Hard beds & insufficient parking.
review.reviewText: The motel is about three blocks from Davies Hall, where we went to see Liza Minnelli. The rooms is nice but nothing special. The bed is so hard, my whole body ached for days. There are not enough parking spaces for the amount of rooms. We got into a small space, but had a horrible time getting out. The only reason we would go back would be because of an event at Davies Hall.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Softer mattresses on the beds and more parking.
review.locationRemarks: Davies Hall.

review.title: Meets basic needs.
review.reviewText: It's nothing fancy, but then I wasn't willing to pay fancy prices either. Since we didn't plan to spend much time at our hotel there really wasn't any point. The floor kinda was kinda icky, but every hotel floor gives me the creeps. We had to request more tp because there wasn't even a full roll when we got there, but they brought it to us promptly. The area wasn't bad, so if I were traveling on a budget I would stay there again.

review.title: The room was small but good enough to sleep in.
review.reviewText: It is a small hotel but fixation was great. Hotel was right on public transportation.

review.title: Definitely staying again if needed/stayed 9 nights
review.reviewText:
Pros: location(no hobos), small breakfast, HUBBY LOVED WIFI REALLY FAST, Reference sheet for info like restaurants, laundry locations, transportation

Cons: picture TV bad, smell in room (cant explain it & had buy smell good spray), blow-dryer needs replaced (randomly shuts off and over heats with smell of plastic burning after 5mins)

Going stay here again if needed. Good for on budget.
review.positiveRemarks: Pros: location(no hobos), small breakfast, HUBBY LOVED WIFI REALLY FAST, Reference sheet for info like restaurants, laundry locations, transportation
review.negativeRemarks: Cons: picture TV bad, smell in room (cant explain it & had buy smell good spray), blow-dryer needs replaced (randomly shuts off and over heats)
review.locationRemarks: location is next to city hall, and opera/sympthany near hayes valley.

review.title: Outdated hotel, sketchy area
review.reviewText: First off, the parking is very limited. When I arrived I walked around the corner to check out the area and within 5 mins I was being hassled by homeless/crazy people, not the best area in town. In the rooms, they are still using CRT Tvs, would it kill them to update? I was on the ground floor and could hear the people on the next floors every foot step. The final straw for me was another guest decided to leave their dogs in their RV in the car park all night, so was kept awake by the dogs barking. After all of this I decided to check out a day early and go somewhere better.
review.positiveRemarks: Not a whole lot
review.negativeRemarks: Most things if I'm honest.
review.locationRemarks: You can always go and speak with the homeless, there are tons of them in this area

review.title: decent
review.reviewText: The price was slightly high but generally it is clean and comfortable, located at a nice place.

review.title: Old motel manages to make for a comfortable stay!
review.reviewText: Reception staff was businesslike and helpful when needed. The facility is old with small "breakfast" nook (no seating) to get small breakfast items (toast, cereal, bagels, apples, etc.). Rooms were clean and neat and upkeep with paint and aesthetics nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to hospitals, easy to get to.
review.negativeRemarks: New elevator, better parking (although the free parking in SF is GREATLY APPRECIATED!).
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find, not far from main arteries through The City. A hamburger stand right by the parking lot was a God-send to late-arriving travelers weary.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Nice enough place. Fairly close to downtown. Maybe not ideal for tourists

review.title: San Francisco Civic Center
review.reviewText: Very clean a quite a large room - especially in San Franciso. Good location for getting on public transportation. Restaurants within a few blocks. Try to get on the top floor - walls are a little thin............
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast could be better. toaster didn't work so toast, english muffins were out..........

review.title: adequate
review.reviewText: a bit tired but adequate...wasn't expecting the Ritz, just a clean room and a comfortable bed, and got both.

review.title: good location in quiet neighborhood
review.reviewText: went over for Giants series with Colorado. rooms were clean and taxi were easy to get.
review.positiveRemarks: nice rooms, clean and not bad location
review.negativeRemarks: more parking..............

review.title: Good Place to stay
review.reviewText: Overall in a good location for what we were visiting San Franscisco for. The rooms were clean.
review.positiveRemarks: They offer free parking with a room. Parking is very difficult in area.
review.negativeRemarks: Do some repairing a facility. Door in bathroom was very difficult to close. Need new toliets.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of food options in the area. Great little park next block over. Area will be great once construction on building next door is completed.

review.title: Easy to get everywhere from
review.reviewText: We had a great time, very easy to get around, if you go left out the gate and about 2 blocks you have the Bus, Trains, etc
review.positiveRemarks: Very Very Clean, and really nice people to deal with
review.negativeRemarks: Would like to have had Fruit to put on cornies, but still a great breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Buses, trains, Cafes.

review.title: Ghetto chic
review.reviewText: The front desk person was helpful. No laundry facilities. He warned us not to leave anything in the car. Had us on the fourth floor. The room was a decent size for 4 people. Older fixtures. Mold in the grouts and stains on the bottom mattress of the bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to the city
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: walked around Hayes. Lots of bars and restaurants. Great atmosphere.

review.title: Safety and security!! Poor!
review.reviewText: If you have children just pay more and don't go here

review.title: Central location to all areas of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very responsive and accommodating to my specific needs. The hotel was very clean and well kept. Good location with nearby restaurants and public transportation.The free parking was awesome!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very helpful and understanding.
review.locationRemarks: Hayes Valley restaurants and shops were just one block away. The MUNI/BART subway system was just 4 blocks away. Union Square was just 10 blocks.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Hayes Valley has a lot to see and do so the hotel was in a great location. The breakfast could have ben better. Just adding some bananas and peanut butter would have improved it nicely. Staff wasn't overly friendly. Both days we went to breakfast, the woman on duty didn't say anything to us. The 2nd morning I said good morning and she reciprocated.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, free parking, breakfast available, cleanliness, quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Hayes Valley is wonderful. Close to Civic center, Mission District. Lots of cool shops, restaurants. Lots of good walking destinations.

review.title: Great hotel for any age
review.reviewText: Everything about our stay at this location exceeded our needs. We will book again on our next stay in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff and upkeep.
review.negativeRemarks: Price but I can't roll back the clock to earlier times.
review.locationRemarks: Great for a central hub to all the sites we wanted to visit.

review.title: Good, clean, inexpensive hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was a good, clean, inexpensive hotel in San Francisco that was close to attractions but not within walking distance although we did walk to Japantown from there. It was clean and the breakfast was pretty good. It's an older building, but kept in good condition. Carpet was kind of old but didn't seem dirty. Parking was a bit difficult to squeeze in there but we made it work. Overall very pleased with this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: cleanliness and close to attractions
review.negativeRemarks: new carpet maybe
review.locationRemarks: easy drive to all the main attractions in San Francisco, some within walking distance if you don't mind walking a few miles.

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText: Nice place, huge bathroom. The area is just far enough from things to be reasonably quiet while still close enough to walk to transit and various sites of interest. Clean and comfortable. Usual loud and very drying AC/heater unit, which worked fine.

review.title: Regular customer
review.reviewText: Love this neighborhood, Hayes Valley. Always a positive experience at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean comfortable room.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast "included" is a joke.

review.title: Nice location. Clean rooms.
review.reviewText: Nice location. Clean rooms. Many restaurants and things to do near this hotel.

review.title: Great for quick stop
review.reviewText:
We needed a place for one night. It had decent prices for the city.

If you're ever going to Bay to Breakers this is the place to stay! They have free parking or a gated event parking across street.
review.positiveRemarks: The convenience of being so close the Civic Center.
review.negativeRemarks: It was a little dated but for the price, I was very happy!
review.locationRemarks: It had some great cafes and coffee shops in the surrounding cute neighborhood. Also, there is a burger and sandwich shop connected to the hotel!!

review.title: Nice, convenient hotel
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel close to the centre of San Fran at a reasonable price.
Only two negatives, which were the rude lady on the check in desk and the fact that the carpet in our room needed a good shampoo.

review.title: Good hotel and value, but parking is a nightmare
review.reviewText:
Good value & nice room, especially for the price, and in a good neighbourhood with a lot going on. BUT- parking at this hotel is IMPOSSIBLE!

Each of the four nights we were there, the lot was full before we returned for the evening, many of the cars not having hotel parking permits, so probably just people going out and using the free parking. The staff won't enforce the parking restriction, and won't make people move or have them towed if they are parked there but not staying at the hotel, and they get pretty hostile when you ask for other solutions.

We tried parking on the street one night last time we stayed, but our car was vandalized, so this time, we had to park along one edge of the lot and just keep going out to move the car every time it was in someone's way, all night. It's a hassle that has us reconsidering staying here again, even though otherwise, it's great.
review.positiveRemarks: Good value, fridge and microwave in room, great lively neighbourhood
review.negativeRemarks: Parking nightmare, hotel staff attitude

review.title: Good for the price.
review.reviewText: Check-in was quick. Location of hotel is good. It's one of the few hotels that have free parking. Check-out was quicker.

review.title: Title of Review
review.reviewText: it was ok. room did not smell bad. there was a wet bar with a fridge and a microwave in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: it was close the the club we went to.
review.negativeRemarks: the elevator was a little bit scarey.
review.locationRemarks: there is a burger place on property, one burger was about 9.00.

review.title: Nice experience at Days Inn
review.reviewText:
I wanted to stay in Downtown SF at a decent hotel, but at an affordable price. This hotel was just perfect to my requirement. I stayed there for 4 nights, and I am happy I chose this place.

The property looked kind of old, but rooms are maintained well. My room was clean & big enough for a couple. The room ambiance (specially colors) was kind of classic. It included all the required amenities like microwave, refrigerator, iron & ironing board, coffee machine, etc.

It serves complimentary breakfast, but that's just minimal: cereals, cold milk, coffee/tea, bread-butter-jam, pastry, and one fruit. This is just what I needed for starting my day.

While the hotel location is close to downtown places, it's not that bad to a downtown experience. It becomes lonely after sunset, and does not look safe walking around; there are lot of homeless people around.
For food, there are good number of restaurants & bars around in walking distance.

Parking is free at the hotel, but there are not much parking lots. If all rooms are full, you may not get a parking space. Good thing is you can move around in SF without a car, in fact that is recommended. There is a bus-stop at the corner of the hotel and it can take you to other connecting stations. The BART station is also near-by.

If you are traveling with family & children, there is nothing much at hotel or around.

If you are visiting SF and will be out most of your day, this is nice place for stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Value for the price
review.negativeRemarks: No recreation around the hotel in walking distance, and not safe for walking during night.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good if you are going to be out for all day.

review.title: Near the War Memorial Opera House
review.reviewText: We stay here when we go to the SF Ballet. It is walking distance, free parking and it's a comfortable, no nonsense place to stay for a good price.

review.title: Parking problem
review.reviewText:
The nastiest surliest front desk staff I have ever met.
I asked how to use the remote control. Answer:"you have a Tv at home don't you?
Also they don't have a parking space for everyroom and so parking is not guaranteed they told me one morning when there was np place to park on site.
Caveat emptot!
review.positiveRemarks: Good location if you want to be in Hayes Valley, near civic center
review.negativeRemarks:
parking
surly staff

review.title: Dissaponited in SF
review.reviewText: The bedroom was clean, the beds comfortable. The continetal breakfast was minimum, you can hardly call it that. The staff was dreadful, very unfriendly and right down rude.Unless you are bookin a last minute deal and there is no other hotel available, I reccomend that you stay somwhere else if at all possible.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff, continental breakfast .
review.locationRemarks: Location was good, which is why I suspect they get bookings.

review.title: Bad and bad hotel!!!!
review.reviewText: İt is awfull. Dirty and bad smell. That is why I dont recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Bad

review.title: Great hotel location, clean, friendly, comfy
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel if you are not looking for a 5 star hotel. Of course it is not the Highest quality hotel, but it is a great hotel for a vacation. The room we stayed in had 2 queen beds, microwave, fridge, coffee pot. Has a seperate little sink area like a small kitchenette. The room was huge and very clean. The location is awesome, as it is very close to lots and a very easy ride to the Wharf. If I got to SF again, I would be staying here. The parking is free unlike most hotels. There is alot of parking, but I dont think enough for every single room. We had a spot every night and we did come home late too. There is also street parking. There is a continental breakfast, which is great for us. I really enjoyed staying there. I stayed at a travel lodge 2 years ago in SF and it has terrible. The beds were super comfortable. Great for families too. The staff was very nice. We got there 3 hours before check in time and they let me check into my room. The room is really clean and not smelly or old looking like some places. I was very impressed and satisfied.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is PERFECT, clean comfy room. FREE parking, safe area.
review.negativeRemarks: There was nothing I had to complain about. Nothing bad to say
review.locationRemarks: Perfect area, close to the symphony, civic center and lots more. Easy to and from Wharf from this location. Close drive to pretty much anyplace.

review.title: For the small(er) budget
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. That means two things: it's cheap (at least for SF downtown), but it's okay. The breakfast is not bad, but you have to grab everything and bring it to your room, b/c there is not such a thing like a breakfast room/area. The rooms are a bit small and dark, but clean and well maintained. Some stuff members are not that friendly, others are. The free WiFi is a plus, but sometimes a bit slow. I liked my stay though, would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Free WiFi, close to everywhere (at least by car).

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: An excellent location (2 blocks from the Opera) and a excellent value for the price. The room was clean and everything worked. The carpet was getting a bit threadbare, but who cares if you get a pleasant night of sleep in a great location.

review.title: Two Seniors Enjoying The Good Life
review.reviewText:
Check out hotel prices for downtown SF and you will see what a good price Days Inn offers. Perfect location. Walked to the opera house at night with streets well lit. 21 Hayes bus line in front of hotel takes you to The Ferry Building at the end of the line. Check its various shops and next, with your transfer in hand, take an antique street car (F Line) to Pier 39 or Fisherman's Wharf.

Senior Muni fares 75 cents. Adults $2.00. Exact change only.

Bus line 5 up two blocks from motel takes you to the center of Golden Gate Park, De Young Museum, Tea Garden, etc. (Tenth Street stop) The hotel's two maps were much appreciated. Forget your diet and splurge on nearby restaurants on Hayes. Hotel is really a motel. "If it doesn't move paint it" seems to be their philosophy. Four day stay for us two seniors. Wish they had hand holds in shower/bath.

Basic continental breakfast. No space in office/breakfast area to sit and eat. Bring your room tray with you and load up. Our third floor room (used the elevator) was quiet. We are looking forward to doing the whole trip again. Dining in SF is always a delight. Don't look for McD's or any other chain type eateries in area. With all the money you saved on the room and parking and using the bus, you can, guilt free, splurge on all the city's many dining delights. The motel is in the middle of Hayes Valley area. A young and vibrant neighborhood. Days Inn Civic Center was perfect for the two of us. N&J
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to city center and tourist attractions.

review.title: Good deal for the money.
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the money. Very close to opera house and civic center. Bus stop nearby. The neighborhood was a little run down on that block of Grove St. But nice just two blocks over towards the opera house. Easy bus ride to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was comfortable and clean
review.negativeRemarks: Needs some vending machines on the property. Could not get a pop or snack late at night.

review.title: Family stay
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 4 nights. Good location in terms of access to public transportation and some attractions (e.g. AT&T Ballpark). Some might not like strolling Market Street especially late at night on the way home with kids. Hotel itself was absolutely OK.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean and comfortable hotel. Golf Channel on TV - less favoured by other family members :-)
review.negativeRemarks: Market street can be disappointing with kids (and you can not avoid walking it from time to time)

review.title: great location for the price
review.reviewText: Great location for the price. Would stay again and recommend it to others.

review.title: Okay for the price
review.reviewText: If you like walking you can from this location. For the price it's okay and we felt safe in the area. Staff were helpful and friendly. There is no place to eat except your room and getting your breakfast is in a tight area. They have just the usual toast, cereal, muffins, juice and coffee. If you want more down a block and around the corner are a few cute coffee houses with food.
review.positiveRemarks: Bus lines close
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet in rooms looked really dirty
review.locationRemarks: We traveled by train and were busses in. Our driver dropped us off at the civic center and we walked to the hotel.

review.title: SF Downtown / Civic Center Area
review.reviewText: A good stay. Great location. Clean hotel. Free parking on hotel lot. Free WiFi.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Downtown / Civic Center Area, Hayes Valley close by.

review.title: Great location, great deal, clean rooms.
review.reviewText: Wonderful location and clean rooms. We needed a hotel near the Civic Center that had free parking, and this hotel couldn't have been better! The rate was fine, rooms were clean, location was close to public transportation (close to buses, underground Muni station at Van Ness, and about 8 blocks from BART). I would definitely stay here again
review.positiveRemarks: Location and free parking
review.locationRemarks: So convenient!

review.title: My stay.
review.reviewText: Good price for San Francisco. Good neighborhood, quiet, close to restaurants. Room is good. THE MATRESS was so uncomfortable! If you would get a comfortable matress it would be such a great stay. I sure hope you do for next time, if not, I won't be able to stay again. You are upgrading and seem to be trying to make it a comfortable hotel. The access to room 301 is like a long maze, and if you want to bring coffee, juice or muffins up it is a nightmare. Make the door next to the office in and out access. You may want to put an elevator on that end too and upgrade the one you have. Other then that I give you a 7 out of 10. Good job.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: The bed. Access to my room (301)
review.locationRemarks: Close to restuarants and your price was fair.

review.title: B+
review.reviewText: No soda machines, but free juice and morning continental breakfast was fine. Employees very cordial, good location. Will stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff.
review.negativeRemarks: No drink machine for late night use.
review.locationRemarks: great location, close to lots

review.title: Overall Good, big and comfortable
review.reviewText: Clean and comforts, but smaller TV and best from one first bed and only fair from other bed. able. Nice beds, not to firm, not not soft. Plenty of room. If you are a TV watcher, had plenty of stations to choice from, but kinda smaller TV and really best from first bed, rather than other. Nice shower, good water pressure, hot water quick and adjustable shower head (at least in our room)
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort and large room
review.negativeRemarks: Small elevator
review.locationRemarks: Just a couple blokes to public transportation

review.title: location location location
review.reviewText: Perfect for a not too busy downtown feel type location
review.positiveRemarks: Walk to anything
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Eat, drink, play in every direction and in walking distance

review.title: Best Bang For the $$
review.reviewText: Great price for the room, it's clean, perfect for sleeping and spending the day touring.
review.positiveRemarks: It's in downtown S.F.
review.negativeRemarks: Recommend staying on top of the floors instead of bottom because you can hear the foot steps.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for food and sight seeing.

review.title: Happy guest
review.reviewText:
Single in San Francisco for 5 day conference and 4 days vacation. Travelled with colleague also staying in this hotel. Contrary to some other reviewers we did NOT find the area to be dodgy; we did not feel at all uncomfortable walking around, which we did extensively every day and every evening. I found this to be a very good 2 star hotel, staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast very adequate, though it's a bit wierd fetching it in reception and going to the room to consume it; no big deal though. The room was absolutely fine, very clean and comfortable, including the bathroom. All facilities in the room were fine as well. Excellent burger joint on site. Easy 15 minute walk to BART station @ Civic Centre, good access to bus routes to CBD 1-5 mins walk. 7 mins walk to Van Ness bus stops for Union street / North Pier area. Enough restaurants/breakfast joints within 5mins walk. 25 mins brisk walk to Moscone Centre.

Simple & unpretentious hotel - excellent value for money
review.positiveRemarks: Clean comfortable room, good staff, easy access to buses and excellent value for money
review.negativeRemarks: Fetching breakfast at reception, eating in room. Very minor issue
review.locationRemarks: Fine, as above

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Front desk person was extremely rude during check-in and check-out.
review.positiveRemarks: Near the Civic Center
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk person

review.title: One night stay
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, the room was clean, the amenities were nice and the noise level was very acceptable. What more could you ask for?

review.title: Simple but just right
review.reviewText: We were looking for a reasonably priced, nothing fancy place near the War Memorial Opera House (going to the Nutcracker SF ballet) that was walking distance. This fit the bill perfectly! Again, nothing fancy, just basic, but exactly what we needed!

review.title: Best hotel in San Fran -for the money
review.reviewText: Excellent stay. The usual motel style place with fridge and microwave. Cleaner than most in this price range. Super free wifi. The usual breakfast...but for the money, it can't be beat! Bus stop outside. 10 min walk to muni and Bart on Market.

review.title: Nice, but inexpensive hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: Decent hotel for very good price in an excellent neighborhood of San Francisco. This is a regular spot for us when we visit our daughter in SF. It isn't quite so convenient to Union Square, but there are some great restaurants and coffee shops in the area and the neighborhood feels quite safe to us.

review.title: Best accommodations for the money in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location and the convenience of parking on the premises is a real plus. A special thank you to the head desk person, Brandon (or Brendon), for his assistance.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: nice

review.title: price is right
review.reviewText: It's San Fran. Good value here.

review.title: Good location, great front desk staff, parking an issue
review.reviewText: This hotel is very utilitarian - so, the location is great, but the room is not. It's large, but the bed is VERY hard, and everything else is really mediocre. My biggest issue is with the "free" parking - I guess you really do get what you pay for. There are only about 20 spaces total at the property, and if you don't snag a space during daylight hours, you will be hard-pressed to get one at night, and street parking is almost non-existent.

review.title: OK clean, good location, free parking (limited), comfy bed & pillow.
review.reviewText: It is better than I expected. The toilet was clean and the bed & pillows are comfortable. There is microwave and fridge in the room. The room wasn't that big but ok for staying for a night.

review.title: Repeat guests
review.reviewText:
This is our second stay and will keep going back there. It is close to my in-laws' place. We just parked our car and walked around downtown and surrounding areas.

I tried to use our Equity Life Style membership discount because Days Inn is one of the Preferred Access hotels but it was not honored. We will stay there again next summer so I hope to make use of our vacation membership.

We came on a very busy Labor Day week maybe....as we witnessed the chaos of preparation for the San Francisco Opera 100th year Gala.

review.title: practical for the price
review.reviewText: the room was clean. the breakfast was small. there was some road noise.

review.title: Beverly Hills Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is just wonderful. Almost all employees made me feel welcome. Some of them are really helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. I was happy to get so much help from the Bellman who work there, with reservations, information and of course my luggage. The room was big, comfortable and were well equipped. There is everything we needed, just like at home. The breakfast is perfect !!!!: freshly made Omelets, lots of warm dishes and everything for a very rich breakfast. The room was very clean. The only thing I could recommend is to have a car for this stay, as there is no public transport to the center of the city. We could use complementary transport from our hotel to any place within 4 miles from 7 am to 7 pm, but there is a reservation needed at least 2 hours in advance, which is not mentioned in any hotel info letter , that is why we could not use this service. We were depended on private shuttle services and taxis, which is very expensive if someone moves a lot around the city. The nearest bus to the center ( Hollywood ) is about 45 minutes fast walk from the hotel and is takes about 90 minutes to get there with two buses. I tried it once and never again. The taxi needs about 15-20 minutes to the center Hollywood and it costs around 30 USD. I would love to returned to this hotel, but only if I will rent a car for my entire stay.

review.title: Long time customer
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Days Inn SF any many times. Staff is always very kind and professional. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The only thing that was not as it has been in the past, was the amount of noise from other guests.

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText: From the photos on the site, I expected the hotel to be indoors, but it wasn't. It's more like a motel, and right near Civic Center. Location is great if you're looking to explore City Hall, the Opera House and Symphony Hall -- but it can be noisy, there isn't much privacy, and seedy characters hang around the area at night.

review.title: Okay accomodations if location is most important to you - less expensive/less appealing
review.reviewText:
Clean enough and safe enough.

Not visually appealing, poor lighting indoor but good range of cable channels and in room fridge. Female desk worker gave good restaurant recommendation nearby. About a block from the Opera house and venues. Lets you book one night at a time. Cute shopping street and restaurants nearby. Has a burger place attached to the motel building. Limited parking free if available. Other parking available adjacent for fee.

This is a room you book for practicality and not for luxury or any sense of "escape".

Would avoid in the future, but would also stay there again if I wanted a place just to crash at night. Not near enough public transit other than buses. Taxi's NOT available on a rainy day so without a car or walking in the rain, you are "stuck" here.

review.title: They Just Don't Care!!
review.reviewText: Well the location was good, but that was about all I could say positive. When we arrived I checked in and entered the room and noticed there was only 1 bed. I had booked 2 beds. When I went to complain they said that there were no other rooms available. I explained how I called to confirm my reservation a few days earlier even though I booked the room months ago. They said sorry and offered to roll in a bed that was basically a cot on wheels. Not Acceptable! I've stayed at a lot of Days Inn's but would never stay at this one again. Hotels today are forgetting what Customer Service means. They just don't get it. I'm done with DAYS INN. I have another reservation booked for later this year, I'm canceling it.

review.title: best value in san francisco!
review.reviewText: This hotel was everything and more. We had to check-in late, after 9 p.m., and our reception was warm and friendly. The room was huge, the bed comfortable, very clean. The neighborhood offered everything from a small grocer, a deli, and a wonderful park. I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: You can do better
review.reviewText: This hotel was not too bad. The room was clean and the area was okay. One complaint about the room was that our microwave did not work. Second was that the noise from the room above kept us up for hours. You could get on a bus one block from the hotel which was a nice benefit. However, the service and hotel personnel are not friendly at all. They stare at you with a stone face whenever you have a question. Lastly, I had a very important item sent to the hotel. That evening I was told it did not arrive. When I went in the next morning to check on it again, I was told that it had arrived but the front office personnel did not know it. This was extremely frustrating. Due to the poor service and attitude of the office personnel I would not stay here again.

review.title: Excellent Place!
review.reviewText: Loved it!

review.title: UCSF
review.reviewText: We recently had to go to UCSF and this hotel fit our needs very well. We found that the hotel itself was convenient to UCSF and the surrounding area had restaurants offering good meals.

review.title: very convenient
review.reviewText: Older structure, rate included parking! Very convenient to Opera House, Symphony Hall, great restaurants, museums, all within easy walking distance.

review.title: Perfect place to stay for San Francisco Opera
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with service, EXCEPT housekeeper who ignored sign and my verbal instruction not to disturb the room. I'll assume she wanted to assure its condition.

review.title: Beware of available Free Parking
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was sufficient in a convenient location with close access to public transportation. Under the hotel anemities available free parking is metioned. Being that there are approximately 40 rooms and only about 20 parking spaces it should say LIMITED free parking available.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This Days Inn has a great location, it is very close to public transportation and good restaurants. It is obviously at least 30+ years old, so a bit shabby but not dirty at all. The continental breakfast is not quality, so don't count on that as your first meal of the day. All in all, for the price, it was exactly what I was expecting and what I received.

review.title: Well worth the money!
review.reviewText: Don't let the price fool you...this was well worth money. I did a search and this was the only one that was affordable in SF, other than near the airport. The room was big and clean. I mean not fancy but clean. The customer service was friendly, they also provide "snacks" at the front desk for breakfast.

review.title: Great hotel location.
review.reviewText: Clean place great location in this nice neighborhood near civic center. Easy access to public transportation or could walk to most places.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay when you want to be close to the Civic Center, the Opera, Ballet etc. We had a huge room with a fridge and microwave. This is the best place for the money!!!

review.title: Reasonable, convenient location
review.reviewText: This is an affordable, generic motel in a very convenient location close to the civic center and Opera House. There are restaurants and shopping also easily within walking distance. The motel is nothing special, but was clean and comfortable. Can't say much for the "continental breakfast" -- packaged pastries with coffee and frozen OJ, but other than that I had no complaints. There is also free parking.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Room was clean and nice - parking is a real issue though.

review.title: Dissapointed
review.reviewText: Its an old hotel and the smell in the rooms was bad. We ask the maid to spray some deodorant. You see the photos and it looks nice, but when you are there is not the same. About two years ago we made reservations in a Travel Lodge Hotel near Fishermans Wharf and it is worse than this one.

review.title: Not Fancy, but not too expensive
review.reviewText: Everything in San Fran is expensive, which is pretty annoying, but this hotel actually has some free parking and is very close to the bus/trains. Hotel is not fancy, but it isn't a dump. Need a reasonable hotel in San Fran, you could do a lot worse.

review.title: Affordable S.F rooms + Free Parking
review.reviewText: Wife and I stayed for 1 night and I'ld stay there again. If you're looking for luxury and ammenities go stay at the Hilton, but if all you need is a roof over your head after a long day of sightseeing, I would recommend this place. It was fairly clean and everything in the room worked including the mini-fridge. The Inn itself is nestled amongst residential apartment complexes and relatively safe, but although city hall is only a couple blocks away the civic center area isn't the friendliest after dark so I wouldn't risk wandering the streets at night. S.F looks better during the day anyway. Best part, FREE PARKING (although as mentioned in previous reviews, the lot is quite cramped)

review.title: Convenient to Civic Center
review.reviewText: Days Inn puts one in close contact with Davies Hall, SF Opera and the Civic Center. This is definitely a good value in the vastly overpriced SF downtown area.

review.title: Ideal location for car or motorbike guests
review.reviewText: Close to downtown, 2 blocks from Van Ness Avenue with open and covered free of charge parking. Everything you can expect from a Motel!

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Impressed

review.title: needs improvement but practically okay
review.reviewText: over-all my stay in days in hotel is practically okay. they just didn't inform me that there's free breakfast and drinks. its no big deal really but that could had help me and spared me the walk from the hotel to a coffee shop. i only found out about it the day before my departure. but apart from that everything else is okay. rate is fair, rooms are clean and the people are quite friendly

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Best rate when I was searching; great location near civc center; small but comfortable room; served our purpose well

review.title: Reasonable value for the money.
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this Days Inn on two occasions and have been very pleased. While it is definitely not a "luxury" hotel; the bed was comfortable, the room and bathroom were clean, there was a good selection of tv channels, and there was a refrigerator and microwave oven. There are several nice restaurants in the neighborhood and the MUNI is about a 5 minute walk.

review.title: A bit below average
review.reviewText: Rooms are old and carpet was stained. No parking available if you check-in or return after 5:00 p.m.

review.title: Almost everything was great
review.reviewText: Facilities very satisfacrtory. Vent fan in bathroom didn't work, but was repaired when we mentioned it. The bed was really hard, but everything else was great.

review.title: Dissatisfied
review.reviewText: "Continental Breakfast" consisted of coffee and honey buns. Hair Dryer in room was broken. Far away from San Francisco attractions.

review.title: great bargin
review.reviewText: centrally located,well kept up,friendly efficient staff.though close to major thoroughfares our room was quiet enough to guarantee a restful nights sleep.small refridgerator and microwave worked well and along with cable t.v.,for the price a great bargin.
